{"rating": 6.8, "genres": ["Biography", "Drama"], "review": "While the movie is titled The Big Strike, there is not a single scene where anyone is actually involved in mining for oil. Instead, the film chronicles the rise of a con artist, Donald Cobb Cox, played by James Garner, who moves to West Texas in the early 1930s, and manipulates a group of naive citizens to invest their life savings in an oil company he creates. As it turns out, he has no intention of ever drilling for oil. In reality, he simply pockets the investments and runs off to California to become a successful real estate developer.br br While the plot may sound implausible, Cox is actually based on a real person who did similar things in New Mexico in the early part of the 20th century. He also claimed to have discovered oil on several occasions without ever drilling for it. Despite the historical inaccuracies, the film is entertaining enough to pass the time. However, viewers should be aware that the film contains scenes of violence, including two murders, and strong language.br br Recommended.", "num": 9049013}

{"rating": 7.9, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "A classic movie.br br As a parent, I feel strongly that Huck Finn is one of the most important movies that parents can share with their children.br br Although I grew up listening to Mark Twain read Huck Finn on the radio, I had never seen it until I bought a DVD copy for my granddaughter.br br Her mother watched it several times with her. As a result, my granddaughter learned about the Civil War and slavery. She also learned about prejudice, hypocrisy, courage, and compassion.br br I highly recommend this movie for everyone.", "num": 3140897}

{"rating": 7.0, "genres": ["Documentary"], "review": "Really great documentary that shows how many people struggle to get ahead in our capitalist society.br br This film also offers interesting perspective on how our economy operates. The main character is an economics professor who teaches at the university of chicago and spends a lot of time researching how humans behave in regards to finances. While watching this film, I learned that most of us have irrational tendencies and biases that lead to poor decisions in our personal finances. For instance, we tend to overestimate our ability to invest wisely in the stock market and underestimate our tendency to lose interest in saving money for retirement.br br Additionally, the film explains that many of the economic problems we face stem from the failure of banks to manage our savings appropriately. Although the film focuses primarily on the mortgage crisis, the underlying principles apply to all types of investments. Even though banks appear to be regulated, the fact that Wall Street runs the banks has created conflict of interest for shareholders.br br Overall, this is a solid introduction to behavioral economics and how our economies operate.", "num": 4118548}

{"rating": 8.3, "genres": ["Biography", "Documentary"], "review": "Beautifully filmed documentary that captures the essence of Jazz Music.br br This film is a fantastic introduction to the history of Jazz and the musicians who helped shape it. From Jelly Roll Morton and King Oliver to the Modernists of Duke Ellington, Count Basie and Billie Holiday. It also touches on the impact World War II had on Jazz, the rise of Bebop, and the Civil Rights Movement.br br Beautiful cinematography, great interviews with musicians who lived through it, plus great music.", "num": 3364671}

{"rating": 5.4, "genres": ["Comedy", "Documentary"], "review": "I enjoyed the book. It's a good study of the inner workings of Hollywood, but it was a lot harder to follow than I expected. The authors are clearly fans of the industry and have spent a lot of time researching the subject. They present information and opinions in a neutral fashion which makes it easy to agree or disagree with their points of view.br br However, I found it hard to follow their discussion of the movies. I'm not familiar enough with their references to be able to identify the movies they're discussing. While there are plenty of stills from the films, sometimes the titles aren't listed and the film studio isn't identified. I also found the chapters uneven. Some are informative, others are repetitive. I found the chapter on writers particularly interesting, but it was interspersed with other topics.br br In addition, the book has no index. If you're planning to reference specific material, it may be difficult to locate.br br Finally, I found the movie examples somewhat random. Sometimes the authors discuss a particular film's box office performance, and then suddenly jump to a completely unrelated topic.br br Despite these flaws, I enjoyed reading the book and I plan to continue following the careers of the authors as they pursue their filmmaking career. I also plan to watch the documentaries they produced.br br I hope they continue to produce similar books. I would buy them.", "num": 3258132}

{"rating": 7.1, "genres": ["Biography", "Documentary"], "review": "Pope Francis is a hero to millions.br br Some historians think that the papacy has been weakened by the scandals involving the sexual abuse of children and cover ups within the Vatican.br br Others contend that the Catholic Church is in decline and that the Pope has neither the vision nor the authority to turn it around.br br This movie, directed by Alberto Negri, examines the circumstances surrounding Pope Francis' election and his subsequent decisions and accomplishments.br br These include opening the Vatican archives to research on the Holocaust; reforming the way the Vatican treats the laity; encouraging clergy to leave their positions and find employment outside the Church; and supporting gay rights, interfaith marriages, and divorced parents.br br He has also called for an end to the culture of violence in the Middle East and sought to defuse tensions with Cuba and Nicaragua.br br While some consider his policies moderate, others consider them radical.br br Pope Francis is an admirable man, but he is certainly not perfect.", "num": 6745808}

{"rating": 6.7, "genres": ["Drama", "Western"], "review": "This movie has a special place in my heart. First of all, I was born in San Diego, and grew up in the foothills of Escondido. Many scenes were filmed in San Diego County, including the famous Coronado Bridge. I was impressed with the authenticity of the film, especially the scenery. However, this movie was a bit unrealistic. The characters were mostly heroes, except for Stockburn and his deputies. They were portrayed as villains, which they were not. In reality, Stockburn was a hero, having defeated Indians, bandits, and outlaws. The truth is, there was no western outlaw gang called the Silver River Gang. They were a bunch of drifters who claimed they were working for Stockburn. The leader of the Silver River Gang was James Doolin, who was hanged in 1919. However, the movie shows them led by a character named John Farrenkopf, which is fictitious. Nevertheless, this movie remains one of my favorites, as it reminds me of my childhood growing up in San Diego.br br I highly recommend this movie for anyone interested in the history of the American West.br br WARNING - Contains strong language.", "num": 130236}

One of the highlights of the movie is a fight between the main character and a shark. The director makes the shark look realistic, even though it's digital. And the actor does a fantastic job. But with encouragement from his older brother, Justin, he sets out on a journey to find the girl who helped him cope in the aftermath of his sister's death.br br The plot, which moves at a steady pace, is somewhat predictable, but director Rob Marshall creates a world where everyone shares the same emotional turmoil. {"rating": 7.3, "genres": ["Documentary", "Biography"], "review": "I am happy to share a copy of this fascinating documentary about the Watergate Scandal with friends and neighbors.br br Anyone who wants to learn about the scandal that destroyed the presidency of Richard Nixon and changed the direction of American politics should watch this documentary.br br My husband is obsessed with the topic of Watergate, so I decided to share this video with him. We enjoyed watching the documentary together. We have both enjoyed the book that inspired the documentary.br br In addition, I recommend the book, 'The Nixon Defense', by Vincent Cannell, as well. It provides a comprehensive analysis of the events surrounding the scandal.br br We also enjoyed watching the HBO mini-series, 'Eventuality'. It provides a more detailed description of the events leading up to the scandal, although it does focus more on the personalities of the players than the facts surrounding the scandal.br br Highly recommended.", "num": 3384160}

This is one of those films that you can watch over and over again because there is always something new to see or something new to learn.", "num": 9066681}

{"rating": 6.7, "genres": ["Biography", "Drama"], "review": "I enjoyed the film immensely, especially the performances of the actors, particularly, of Brad Pitt and Jennifer Connelly.br br However, I found the depiction of the AIDS crisis in the mid 1 990s to be extremely inaccurate. Although I was barely 1 0 years old when AIDS first appeared on the scene, I lived through the height of the crisis. While the movie accurately depicts the chaos of the late 1 980s, the early 1 990s were characterized by hope. The HIV epidemic was being controlled. Hospitals and hospices were filled with volunteers. Organizations like ACT UP were lobbying the government for affordable treatment, not jail cells. Even the concept of celebrity advocacy was pioneered by Magic Johnson, not Madonna.br br Overall, however, the film is entertaining, although it fails to portray accurately the reality of AIDS in the early '90s.", "num": 4816268}

{"rating": 6.8, "genres": ["Action", "Crime"], "review": "Good action flick!br br It's about a group of ex-soviet spies who have retired to the United States, including Max Fischer, played by Bruce Willis, and Harry Howe, played by John Saliba.br br Max is a former U.S. Marshal, and Harry is a former CIA agent. Their mission is to prevent the transfer of nuclear weapons technology from the former Soviet Union to Iran.br br Unfortunately, there are also various groups of terrorists who are seeking to acquire this information, and they will resort to anything to get it. Among the terrorists are Russians and Chinese, and eventually it becomes apparent that they have a foreign government's support.br br The film was directed by William W. Dean, who also wrote the screenplay. In addition to the principals named above, the supporting cast includes David Carradine, Ronny Cox, Richard Gere, Robert Stack, and Christopher Walken, among others.br br Some of the scenes are quite violent, and there is brief nudity and profanity. Also, as previously noted, this is a feature-length motion picture, which means it's about 90 minutes longer than regular movies, and requires a rental DVD, instead of a regular movie DVD.br br Overall, this was a fairly entertaining action film with a unique premise, though some viewers may find the plot confusing due to the large ensemble cast and numerous subplots.", "num": 4213255}

{"rating": 6.7, "genres": ["Animation", "Family", "Music"], "review": "I am not fond of movies that have lots of dialogue. This movie did not disappoint. The characters were very relatable and the plot was compelling. I would highly recommend watching this film.br br I am surprised to hear that many reviewers felt that this movie was depressing. The movie is about loss and despair but it is not depressing. It is inspiring. The themes of suicide and depression are presented in a positive light. One cannot help but wonder why more people haven't tried suicide. My son saw this movie and he agreed with my assessment.br br I think the main reason that this movie is so depressing is that it shows real life for most people. Our lives are difficult and painful. However, I think the movie presents the truth beautifully. Life is not always happy. It is often tragic and heartbreaking. And sometimes death seems like the only option.br br This movie is not suitable for young audiences. If you have young children, I suggest watching it first. I do not allow my 9 yr old to watch movies without first checking them out. This movie is worth watching by anyone but especially parents and teachers. There is a wealth of information regarding depression and grief. This movie could save someone's life.", "num": 7640671}

{"rating": 7.5, "genres": ["Documentary", "Religion"], "review": "A beautiful film about the effects of childhood abuse, and the struggle to heal.br br The movie focuses on the plight of the survivors of priest abuse in the Roman Catholic Church.br br One scene early in the movie stands out for me. After viewing the church's portrayal of the Crusades in a history textbook, one of the children asks the teacher if there was any proof that the Crusaders killed and ate babies. The teacher replies, 'No.' The children laugh. In the following classroom discussion, the teacher declares that it would have been reasonable to believe that the Crusaders did kill and eat babies.br br Although there are numerous scenes depicting horrific events, the film is neither graphic nor gratuitous. It focuses solely on the experiences of the survivors, and their quest for justice. It is compelling.br br I recommend this movie to anyone interested in learning more about the Catholic Church and its problems.", "num": 3097935}

{"rating": 7.3, "genres": ["Action", "Drama"], "review": "A fantastic film that captures the essence of the Wild West and its legendary characters. While the plotline revolves around Wyatt Earp and his infamous gunfight with Billy Clanton, the movie also delves into the complexities of the West, providing a deeper understanding of the era.br br Overall, Lawman is a captivating and educational film that offers a unique perspective on the Old West. If you're a fan of Western films and are curious about the Wild West, I highly recommend checking out Lawman.", "num": 8244635}

{"rating": 6.5, "genres": ["Documentary", "Music"], "review": "This movie shows the incredible challenges facing disabled people in getting access to places and facilities that the rest of us take for granted. Yet despite this, it demonstrates how these people manage to overcome obstacles and strive to achieve their full potential in life.br br The story follows Rick and Dick Hoyt, two brothers who have spent their entire lives racing bicycles and setting records in the paralympic games. They do this despite the fact that Rick is paralyzed from the waist down and Dick needs assistance in moving his legs.br br Along the way we meet the various support teams helping the Hoyts train and prepare for competition. These teams include trainers, lawyers, assistants, managers, sponsors, and friends. Without them, the brothers would not be able to train nor compete.br br Despite the seriousness of the topic, the movie manages to entertain and inspire with its tales of perseverance and determination. It also reveals the enormous amount of time, expense, and resources required to maintain competitive sports programs for the physically handicapped.br br Recommended to everyone interested in the paralympics and/or disabled persons issues.", "num": 8350946}

{"rating": 6.9, "genres": ["Comedy", "Drama"], "review": "The characters are charming, but overall, it's a decent film. The plot line is simple and straightforward. Some parts are predictable but enjoyable nonetheless.br br This was released in Canada on December 17, 2010.br br Synopsis The story follows the lives of three New Yorkers as they struggle through everyday life. One works at a record label, another runs a restaurant and the third struggles to pay rent. {"rating": 7.6, "genres": ["Drama", "Horror"], "review": "I liked this movie overall, but I couldn't help feeling a sense of foreboding throughout. It's set in the Mojave Desert in California, in an isolated part of the state. The plot revolves around a group of hikers who encounter a creature while traveling through the desert. The creatures attack and murder several of the group. It appears the creature has a penchant for young women.br br A significant portion of the film is devoted to establishing the background of the characters and setting the stage for the events to occur. This is accomplished by the introduction of a number of subplots and a variety of secondary characters. The problem with this approach is that it slows the momentum of the plot considerably. Because the film spends so much time trying to establish the background of the characters and setting of the events, it fails to effectively build the tension necessary for a horror film. As a result, the climax of the film lacks impact. Overall, the film is competently directed, acted, written, and produced. However, it suffers from a lack of focus, a failure to establish the proper tone, and an awkward screenplay. As a result, it fails to achieve its potential and ultimately falls flat.", "num": 8263822}

{"rating": 6.4, "genres": ["Drama", "Romance"], "review": "I loved this movie. I watched it twice.br br My wife loves romantic comedies. She was surprised that I liked it so much. I like to discover twists and turns without the knowledge of others. This movie did just that.br br At its core, this movie is a story about love. Love is a gift that people share. Sharing that gift with someone can be difficult, especially when you know you have to eventually let go of that person. But sometimes, it's necessary to let go. Otherwise, you will continue to hold onto someone whom you have to release.br br This movie shows how hard it is for two people to accept the inevitable, and let go of each other. As I watched, I realized how similar I have been to Betsy. I have allowed my parents to dictate to me what my life should be. I never questioned what I was doing. I never stood up for myself. This movie helped me realize that I have been living a lie. So I am following my dreams, and letting go of people who are no longer supporting me. I cannot allow them to control my destiny. It's impossible.br br There are a lot of emotional moments in this movie, which I thought was a brilliant choice. Even though I was crying, the story was not sad. I was inspired to reach for my dreams. I saw the possibility in my life, and I was determined to follow that path.br br I am grateful for this experience. I hope that others will watch this movie and gain the same inspiration that I gained from watching it. I recommend this movie highly.", "num": 7971989}

He is portrayed as he was, the brilliant and sometimes troublesome man he was.br br The story begins with Leary's childhood and how he was rejected by his peers. This rejection prompted him to develop a pessimistic worldview, which he projected onto everyone he met. His paranoia and distrust of everyone made him a loner and ultimately drove him to invent LSD, a psychedelic drug, and make it illegal in order to protest against the status quo. The film also details how Leary's fame skyrocketed in the 1960s due to the widespread use of his invention, causing him to live a lavish lifestyle, resulting in Leary's downfall. The film ends with Leary's demise in a coma and his eventual recovery, showing that his life was not a waste.", "num": 8597196}

{"rating": 7.4, "genres": ["Action", "Crime", "Drama"], "review": "Another stellar performance from Ethan Hawke and another wonderful character study from Guy Ritchie. The story takes place in Detroit and is centered around a young father who tries to support his wife and daughter while living paycheck to paycheck. He finds employment at a local restaurant, but discovers that he's being manipulated by the manager, Jack, who has ulterior motives for hiring him. Things escalate quickly and Jack ends up assaulting him. However, it is the attack that provides him the catalyst to finally stand up to the abusive manager and leave the restaurant.br br Along the way, Ethan Hawke delivers a strong performance as a seemingly meek and mild mannered employee, who goes from being bullied and humiliated to standing up to his boss. His acting abilities have never been better and he carries the weight of the entire movie on his shoulders. Another solid supporting cast adds to the overall quality of the production.br br In addition, director Guy Ritchie demonstrates his skill as a storyteller by delivering an authentic portrayal of the inner struggles experienced by lower middle class Americans. This is a stark contrast to his previous efforts, which tend to focus on glitz and glamour rather than gritty realism. Overall, the movie is a solid entry in the Guy Ritchie repertoire and fans of his earlier work should enjoy this new offering.br br Recommended.", "num": 6217042}
